P.title: Will a major engineering breakthrough in renewable energy technology occur by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major engineering breakthrough in renewable energy technology is announced and recognized by the scientific community or a reputable energy sector authority. A "major engineering breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly enhances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or scalability of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, or biomass. The breakthrough must represent a clear advancement beyond the current state of the art and have the potential to substantially impact global renewable energy production or consumption. The announcement of the breakthrough must be confirmed by an official press release from a leading scientific institution, energy company, or government agency. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be demonstrable and verifiable, not merely theoretical or speculative. In the event of multiple claims, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one is widely accepted by the scientific community or a reputable energy sector authority.

Developments that only represent incremental improvements or are speculative in nature without empirical validation do not qualify.

P.title: Will the United States announce a major scientific discovery in the field of natural sciences by 2025?

The announcement must come from a recognized U.S. scientific organization or agency (e.g., NASA, National Science Foundation, U.S. Geological Survey) and be widely reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Nature, Science). In the absence of a single defining announcement, a consensus among the scientific community, as evidenced by publications in multiple peer-reviewed scientific journals or presentations at major scientific conferences, will also satisfy this criterion. The discovery must be new, not a development or extension of existing knowledge. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

P.title: Will the United Nations establish a global AI ethics framework by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Nations (UN) has officially established a global framework for artificial intelligence (AI) ethics. The framework must be designed to guide the development, deployment, and governance of AI technologies on a global scale. It must be adopted by the UN through an official act, such as a resolution passed by the General Assembly or an agreement among member states. The establishment of the framework must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must include specific guidelines or principles addressing ethical considerations related to AI, such as transparency, accountability, privacy, and fairness. In the event of a partial or preliminary framework, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear commitment and timeline for the adoption of a comprehensive global framework.

In the absence of clear documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. This question resolves as YES upon the issuance of such a ruling, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

P.title: Will a new algorithm significantly improve cybersecurity measures for political parties in the US by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new algorithm is developed and has been publicly recognized to significantly improve cybersecurity measures for political parties in the United States. Significant improvement is defined as a reduction in successful cyber attacks against political parties by at least 50% compared to the year prior to the algorithm's implementation, as reported by a reputable cybersecurity firm or a governmental cybersecurity agency. The algorithm must be implemented and operational within at least one major political party in the US (Democratic Party, Republican Party, or any other party with national representation). Confirmation of the algorithm's effectiveness must come from credible sources, such as official statements from political parties, cybersecurity firms, or coverage in at least three reputable news outlets (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event that multiple algorithms claim to meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them is verifiably in use and meets the defined improvement threshold.

P.title: Will the United Nations announce a new global initiative to combat climate change by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations has officially announced a new global initiative specifically aimed at combating climate change. The initiative must represent a significant commitment beyond existing programs and must be aimed at reducing global carbon emissions, promoting renewable energy, or enhancing climate resilience. The announcement must come from an official UN source or be confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of an announcement close to the resolution date, the initiative must be clearly defined and have a planned implementation timeline. Initiatives that are purely exploratory, lack specific goals, or are limited to funding research without actionable plans do not meet the criteria for resolution.

Q_given_P.title: Given a new UN global initiative to combat climate change by 2025, will Germany become a global leader in renewable energy technology by 2025?

Then, will Germany be recognized as a global leader in renewable energy technology by December 31, 2025? P.title: Will a new infectious disease outbreak before 2025 lead to a global economic downturn?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a new infectious disease outbreak is identified and leads to a global economic downturn. A "new infectious disease outbreak" refers to the emergence of a disease not previously identified in humans, causing widespread illness. A "global economic downturn" is defined as a decline in global GDP by at least 0.5% over a calendar year, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. The outbreak must be confirmed by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of these two organizations. The economic impact must be directly attributed to the outbreak by the IMF, the World Bank, or a consensus of economic analysts in reputable financial news sources (e.g., Financial Times, Bloomberg, Reuters).

Then, will the value of Bitcoin exceed the US dollar in terms of global transaction volume by 2030? The assessment will be based on data reported by authoritative financial institutions or organizations specializing in tracking cryptocurrency and fiat currency transactions, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, major central banks, or recognized financial market analysis firms. The resolution will consider adjustments for inflation and currency valuation changes over the period. In the event of a close call, where the transaction volumes are within a margin of error of 5% or less, the question will resolve as No.

Advancements must be directly attributable to the challenges or experiences derived from the Russo-Ukrainian War. This can include, but is not limited to, enhanced intrusion detection systems, improved encryption methods, or novel approaches to cybersecurity education and training.

P.title: Will California introduce groundbreaking legislation on digital privacy by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, California has officially introduced legislation that is recognized as groundbreaking in the field of digital privacy. Groundbreaking legislation is defined as laws that significantly enhance the protection of digital privacy rights beyond the current standards as of 2023, or introduce new rights or mechanisms for the protection of digital data that are not present in existing California law or federal law. The legislation must be passed by the California State Legislature and signed into law by the Governor. Confirmation of such legislation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. Proposed but not enacted legislation, or minor amendments to existing laws, do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will a major ethical controversy in medical research lead to global policy changes in health care by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major ethical controversy in medical research leads to the implementation of new global health care policies or significant amendments to existing ones. A "major ethical controversy" is defined as an event or series of events in medical research that raises significant ethical concerns, receives widespread coverage in at least five reputable international news outlets (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters), and prompts a response from international health organizations (e.g., World Health Organization) or coalitions of nations. The new or amended policies must be aimed at addressing the ethical concerns raised and must be adopted by at least 50% of the member states of the World Health Organization. The resolution will consider only policies that have been officially announced and documented by the relevant governing bodies. In the event of multiple controversies, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria.

Q_given_P.title: Given a major ethical controversy in medical research leads to global policy changes in health care by 2030, will the global average temperature rise by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels by 2030?

Then, will the global average temperature rise by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels by 2030? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global average temperature has risen by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels (defined as the average global temperature from 1850-1900). The assessment must be based on the annual average global surface temperature data as reported by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or another authoritative scientific body that provides a comprehensive analysis of global temperatures. In the event that the IPCC or equivalent body does not provide a clear statement or report by the resolution date, this question will resolve based on the consensus of reports from at least three major scientific organizations dedicated to climate science. Edge cases, such as significant revisions to historical temperature data or changes in the methodology for calculating global average temperatures, will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for the most widely accepted scientific standards at the time of resolution.

The new or amended policies must be aimed at addressing the ethical concerns raised and must be adopted by at least 50% of the member states of the World Health Organization. The resolution will consider only policies that have been officially announced and documented by the relevant governing bodies. In the event of multiple controversies, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria.

Q.title: Will the global average temperature rise by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels by 2030?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global average temperature has risen by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels (defined as the average global temperature from 1850-1900). The assessment must be based on the annual average global surface temperature data as reported by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or another authoritative scientific body that provides a comprehensive analysis of global temperatures. In the event that the IPCC or equivalent body does not provide a clear statement or report by the resolution date, this question will resolve based on the consensus of reports from at least three major scientific organizations dedicated to climate science. Edge cases, such as significant revisions to historical temperature data or changes in the methodology for calculating global average temperatures, will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for the most widely accepted scientific standards at the time of resolution.

R.title: Will Russia develop a new vaccine for a global pandemic that is over 90% effective by 2030?
R.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Russia has developed a new vaccine that is confirmed to be over 90% effective against a global pandemic virus. The vaccine's effectiveness must be verified through Phase 3 clinical trial results published in a peer-reviewed medical journal or officially announced by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Russian Ministry of Health. The pandemic in question must be recognized as such by the WHO at the time of the vaccine's development. In the event of multiple vaccines being developed, only the first to meet these criteria will be considered for resolution. The vaccine must be designed for human use. In the absence of direct confirmation from the WHO or the Russian Ministry of Health, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution.

reasons: A major ethical controversy in medical research could influence global health policies, which might intersect with climate change policies, especially if the controversy involves environmental health or climate-related health impacts.

The development of a highly effective vaccine by Russia could be influenced by global health policies and ethical standards, especially if the vaccine development is a response to a climate-induced pandemic.

This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant development in atmospheric science directly influences the market value of one or more major cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, etc.).

The influence on cryptocurrency value must be clearly attributable to the development in atmospheric science, as reported by at least three reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal) or major cryptocurrency analysis platforms.

P.title: Will a study published before 2030 demonstrate a significant impact of climate change on soccer playing conditions worldwide?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, a peer-reviewed study is published demonstrating a significant impact of climate change on soccer playing conditions worldwide. Significant impact is defined as changes that affect the health and performance of players, the scheduling and locations of matches, or the physical conditions of playing fields. The study must be recognized by a leading scientific organization or journal in the field of climate science, sports science, or a related field. In the absence of a single comprehensive study, a consensus among multiple studies published in reputable scientific journals may also satisfy this criterion. The resolution will rely on reports from authoritative sources such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), World Health Organization (WHO), or major sports governing bodies like FIFA. In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these sources will determine the outcome. Edge cases, such as localized impacts not reflective of global trends, do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will India implement a nationwide policy to significantly reduce air pollution levels by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, India has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at significantly reducing air pollution levels. The policy must demonstrate a clear, measurable goal for reduction in major pollutants (e.g., PM2.5, PM10, NOx, SO2) compared to 2020 levels. Significant reduction is defined as a decrease of at least 20% in the annual average concentration of these pollutants across major cities in India. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be in effect, not merely proposed or in a planning stage. In the event of regional policies that collectively cover the entire nation, the question will resolve as Yes if these policies meet the overall reduction goal.

Then, will China lead the world in quantum computing research by 2030? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, China is recognized as the global leader in quantum computing research. Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:

- Publication Volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.
- Citation Impact: Chinese publications in quantum computing must have the highest citation impact, indicating significant influence on the field.
- Technological Breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.

Recognition of China's leadership position must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum, or the annual reports of the National Quantum Initiative or the European Quantum Flagship program.

In the event of a tie in any of the criteria above, additional factors such as international awards in quantum computing, or leadership in international quantum computing collaborations, may be considered.

In the absence of direct academic consensus, coverage by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian) confirming the impact of the genetic discovery on social sciences theories will be considered sufficient. The discovery and its implications must be clearly linked, with no significant controversy regarding the interpretation of the genetic findings.

P.title: Will a breakthrough in physics lead to a significant advancement in solving complex natural science problems by 2030?
P.body: A "breakthrough in physics" refers to a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of physical laws, leading to new theoretical or practical applications in solving complex natural science problems. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a widely recognized breakthrough in physics that results in a significant advancement in solving complex natural science problems. The advancement must be demonstrable through either the publication of research in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, the development of new technology, or the achievement of a previously unattainable scientific milestone. The breakthrough and its implications must be acknowledged by a consensus within the scientific community or by a leading scientific organization (e.g., the National Academy of Sciences, the Royal Society). In the absence of a consensus, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "significant advancement" is defined as a development that enables progress in understanding or solving problems that were previously considered intractable or significantly enhances the efficiency or accuracy of existing solutions.

P.title: Will the Democratic Party (US) secure a majority in both the House of Representatives and the Senate in the 2024 elections?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2025, the Democratic Party has secured a majority of seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate following the 2024 United States general elections. A majority in the House of Representatives is defined as holding more than half of the total seats, which currently stands at 218 out of 435. A majority in the Senate is defined as holding more than half of the total seats, which currently stands at 51 out of 100, or 50 seats plus the Vice President's tie-breaking vote if the Vice President is a Democrat. The resolution will be based on the official election results as certified by the respective state authorities and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, CNN). In the event of a dispute or recount that delays the certification of election results, the resolution date may be extended to accommodate the final certification.

P.title: Will the NFL host a game in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) has officially hosted a regular season or playoff game in a country that, at the time of the game, is under international sanctions by the United Nations, the European Union, the United States, or any other major international body. The game must be part of the official NFL season schedule, and not a pre-season or exhibition game. Confirmation must come from an official NFL announcement or credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). In the event that sanctions are lifted on a country after the announcement of the game but before the game itself, the question will still resolve as Yes if the sanctions were in place at the time of the announcement. Temporary or partial sanctions specifically targeting individuals or entities within the country do not qualify; the sanctions must be country-wide.

P.title: Will the widespread adoption of COVID-19 vaccines lead to a permanent change in workplace dynamics by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant and permanent change in workplace dynamics directly attributable to the widespread adoption of COVID-19 vaccines. Significant change is defined as:
- A permanent increase of at least 20% in the number of employees working remotely or in hybrid models compared to pre-pandemic levels (2019).
- The implementation of permanent flexible working hours by at least 50% of Fortune 500 companies.
- The establishment of permanent health and safety protocols in the workplace, including but not limited to vaccination requirements, that were not standard prior to the pandemic.

Changes must be documented by credible sources, including but not limited to surveys by major human resources consultancies (e.g., Deloitte, PwC), reports from reputable news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian), or official statements from companies. Temporary measures or changes solely due to government mandates that are lifted do not count towards this question's resolution.

- A permanent increase of at least 20% in the number of employees working remotely or in hybrid models compared to pre-pandemic levels (2019).
- The implementation of permanent flexible working hours by at least 50% of Fortune 500 companies.
- The establishment of permanent health and safety protocols in the workplace, including but not limited to vaccination requirements, that were not standard prior to the pandemic.

Changes must be documented by credible sources, including but not limited to surveys by major human resources consultancies (e.g., Deloitte, PwC), reports from reputable news organizations (BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian), or official statements from companies. Temporary measures or changes solely due to government mandates that are lifted do not count towards this question's resolution.

(b) A significant international climate change treaty is ratified. A "significant" treaty is defined as one that includes commitments from at least 75% of the world's nations and aims to reduce global greenhouse gas emissions by at least 40% from 1990 levels by 2050. The treaty must be ratified by the participating countries' governments or relevant governing bodies. Ratification is confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The treaty must be new, not an amendment or extension of an existing treaty. In the event of multiple treaties, the question resolves as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

(c) A significant breakthrough in the field of social physics is announced and has influenced public policy. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of social physics in a way that directly impacts public policy formulation or implementation. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference. The influence on public policy must be evidenced by the adoption of new policies, significant amendments to existing policies, or the initiation of public policy debates directly attributable to the breakthrough. The adoption or amendment of policies must be confirmed by official government documentation or statements from a recognized authority in the field. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, as evidenced by citations in subsequent research or endorsements by recognized experts in the field.

P.title: Will South Korea become the leader in global digital governance by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea is recognized as the global leader in digital governance. Recognition must come from at least two of the following authoritative sources: the United Nations, the World Bank, the Digital Nations (formerly known as the D5), or a consensus among at least three major technology-focused publications (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, The Verge). Criteria for leadership in digital governance include but are not limited to: - Implementation of advanced digital services across government sectors. - Adoption of cutting-edge technologies in public administration. - Demonstrable impact of digital governance on improving public services and citizen engagement. - Leadership in international digital policy discussions and agreements. In the event of a tie or close competition with another nation, the question will resolve as Yes only if South Korea is clearly distinguished as the leader by the majority of the aforementioned sources. Edge cases, such as temporary leadership positions or recognition in a single aspect of digital governance, do not meet the resolution criteria.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on South Korea becoming the leader in global digital governance by 2030, will the integration of AI into financial systems cause the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:

Edge cases, such as temporary leadership positions or recognition in a single aspect of digital governance, do not meet the resolution criteria.

Then, will the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) into financial systems cause the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly by 2030? This will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the integration of AI into financial systems has caused the value of the US dollar to fluctuate significantly. Significant fluctuation is defined as a change of more than 10% in the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian Dollar, Swiss Franc, and Australian Dollar) within a single calendar year, as reported by the Federal Reserve. The fluctuation must be directly attributed to the integration of AI into financial systems, as confirmed by statements from the Federal Reserve or credible financial analysis from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Financial Times, Reuters). In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among economic experts in peer-reviewed journals or major financial conferences indicating AI's significant impact on the dollar's value will also be considered.

P.title: Will there be a significant shift in environmental philosophy influencing global climate policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant shift in environmental philosophy that influences global climate policy. A "significant shift" is defined as the adoption of a new or substantially revised environmental philosophy that leads to the implementation of new global climate policies or the amendment of existing ones. This shift must be recognized and reported by at least three major international organizations involved in climate change (e.g., United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, World Meteorological Organization) or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The new or revised philosophy must lead to actionable policy changes at the international level, such as new global agreements, significant amendments to existing treaties, or the establishment of new global climate goals. The resolution will consider the consensus of the scientific community and authoritative sources on the matter. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the preponderance of evidence from the specified sources.

In the absence of an official declaration, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the recession will be sufficient for resolution. P.title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announce a new initiative to combat a global health crisis before 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially announces a new initiative aimed at combating a global health crisis. The initiative must be specifically designed to address a health issue with the potential to affect a significant portion of the global population. The announcement must be made through an official CDC press release or a public statement by a high-ranking CDC official. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. The initiative must be new, not an extension or modification of existing programs. In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert opinion in the public health community.

Q_given_P.title: Given the CDC announces a new initiative to combat a global health crisis before 2025, will Tesla's advancements in battery technology lead to a breakthrough in energy storage for scientific research by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Tesla has announced or demonstrated a breakthrough in battery technology that significantly enhances energy storage capabilities for scientific research purposes. A "breakthrough" is defined as a development that results in at least a 50% improvement in energy storage capacity, efficiency, or cost reduction compared to the best available technology as of 2023. The breakthrough must be applicable and scalable for use in scientific research, including but not limited to, energy storage for high-energy physics experiments, space exploration, or environmental monitoring. Confirmation of such a breakthrough must come from an official Tesla announcement or be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of direct confirmation, peer-reviewed scientific publications that cite Tesla's technology as the basis for the advancement qualify as evidence. The technology must be beyond the prototype stage and demonstrate practical applicability for scientific research.

P.title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, machine learning algorithms have been demonstrated to surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior in at least one major industry (e.g., retail, finance, entertainment). The surpassing of human accuracy must be evidenced by a peer-reviewed study or a comprehensive report from a reputable analytics or research firm. The study or report must compare the predictive accuracy of machine learning algorithms against that of experienced human professionals in the same field, using standardized metrics for accuracy. The findings must be recognized and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or industry-specific publications. In the event of conflicting reports or studies, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the most reputable sources. Machine learning algorithms are defined as systems that use statistical techniques to learn from data and make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed for the task.

P.title: Will a significant international climate change treaty be ratified by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant international climate change treaty is ratified. A "significant" treaty is defined as one that includes commitments from at least 75% of the world's nations and aims to reduce global greenhouse gas emissions by at least 40% from 1990 levels by 2050. The treaty must be ratified by the participating countries' governments or relevant governing bodies. Ratification is confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The treaty must be new, not an amendment or extension of an existing treaty. In the event of multiple treaties, the question resolves as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

A "significant discovery" is defined as a discovery that leads to a substantial revision of the Standard Model of particle physics, or provides empirical evidence for phenomena not predicted by the Standard Model, such as supersymmetry, extra dimensions, or dark matter interactions. Computational methods include, but are not limited to, simulations, data analysis algorithms, and machine learning techniques. The use of computational methods must be central to the discovery, not merely supplementary. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

P.title: Will Amazon engage in a significant geopolitical initiative by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially announced or is credibly reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) to have engaged in a significant geopolitical initiative. A "significant geopolitical initiative" is defined as any action or series of actions by Amazon that significantly influences the policies, economy, or diplomatic relations of one or more countries. This may include, but is not limited to, major investments in infrastructure with strategic importance, entering into agreements with governments that have a substantial impact on trade policies, or initiatives that significantly affect geopolitical stability or alignments. The initiative must be beyond Amazon's usual business operations and have a clear geopolitical impact. In the event of ambiguous cases, the consensus among the cited news organizations will be considered for resolution. Temporary or minor engagements do not count towards this question's resolution.

Q_given_P.title: Given Amazon engages in a significant geopolitical initiative by 2025, will the World Health Organization declare a global health emergency due to climate-related diseases by 2030?

2. By December 31, 2030, the World Health Organization (WHO) has officially declared a global health emergency specifically due to the rise in diseases directly attributed to climate change. Such diseases may include, but are not limited to, vector-borne diseases, water-borne diseases, food safety and nutrition-related conditions, and respiratory and cardiovascular diseases linked to air pollution. The declaration must be made explicitly in relation to climate change impacts on health, and must be documented through official WHO announcements or press releases. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the declaration will be sufficient for resolution. Temporary alerts or warnings specific to individual diseases or regions do not count towards this question's resolution.

If the first condition is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

P.title: Will a major social sciences study reveal the impact of engineering advancements on societal structures by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major study in the social sciences is published that reveals significant findings on the impact of engineering advancements (such as artificial intelligence, robotics, green energy technologies, or infrastructure development) on societal structures. The study must be conducted by a reputable academic institution or research organization and must be published in a peer-reviewed journal recognized in the field of social sciences. The findings should address changes in at least one of the following areas: employment, social inequality, urban development, or family dynamics. The study must be cited by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or recognized by a leading academic body in the social sciences as a significant contribution to the field. In the event that multiple studies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the publication of the first study that meets all the specified conditions.

Q_given_P.title: Given a major social sciences study reveals the impact of engineering advancements on societal structures by 2030, will France become the leading European country in terms of GDP by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2030, a major study in the social sciences is published that reveals significant findings on the impact of engineering advancements (such as artificial intelligence, robotics, green energy technologies, or infrastructure development) on societal structures. The study must be conducted by a reputable academic institution or research organization and must be published in a peer-reviewed journal recognized in the field of social sciences. The study must be cited by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or recognized by a leading academic body in the social sciences as a significant contribution to the field. In the event that multiple studies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the publication of the first study that meets all the specified conditions.

Then is the following true: By December 31, 2030, France has the highest Gross Domestic Product (GDP) among European countries, measured in nominal terms (current US dollars) according to the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The GDP figures used for resolution will be the latest available from either organization as of the resolution date. In the event that the World Bank and the IMF provide conflicting data, the source with the most recent publication date will be used for resolution. This question will resolve as No if France does not meet these criteria by the specified date. In case of significant economic events affecting the accuracy of GDP measurements (e.g., a major country leaving or joining the European Union), the question may be extended to allow for updated figures to be considered.

P.title: Will France implement a nationwide carbon-neutral initiative by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide initiative that is recognized as carbon-neutral. The initiative must encompass actions across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, industry, and agriculture, aimed at achieving a net-zero carbon footprint for the country.

The initiative must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

For the purpose of this question, "carbon-neutral" means that any carbon emissions produced by France are balanced by an equivalent amount of carbon sequestration or offsetting measures, within the same calendar year. The verification of carbon neutrality must be conducted by an independent, internationally recognized environmental organization.

In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide coverage by the end of 2030.

Q_given_P.title: Given France implements a nationwide carbon-neutral initiative by 2030, will Japan lead the development of a groundbreaking computing technology by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide initiative that is recognized as carbon-neutral. The initiative must encompass actions across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, industry, and agriculture, aimed at achieving a net-zero carbon footprint for the country.

The initiative must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

For the purpose of this question, "carbon-neutral" means that any carbon emissions produced by France are balanced by an equivalent amount of carbon sequestration or offsetting measures, within the same calendar year. The verification of carbon neutrality must be conducted by an independent, internationally recognized environmental organization.

In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide coverage by the end of 2030.

Furthermore, Japan must be recognized as the leading country in the development of a groundbreaking computing technology by December 31, 2030. Groundbreaking computing technology is defined as a technology that represents a significant advancement over existing technologies in terms of performance, efficiency, or capability, and has the potential to transform the computing industry. The leadership in development must be confirmed through:
- Official announcements from a leading Japanese research institution or technology company;
- Coverage by at least three reputable global news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters);
- Recognition by a reputable international technology or scientific organization.

In the case of collaborative international projects where Japan plays a leading but not exclusive role, the question will resolve as Yes only if Japan's contribution is widely recognized as pivotal and transformative. Technologies that are only incremental improvements or do not have a clear path to commercialization or practical application by 2030 do not meet the criteria for this question.

Then, will a political figure announce a formal initiative to integrate Formula 1 racing into national economic development plans by 2025? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a current political figure has formally announced an initiative to integrate Formula 1 racing into their country's national economic development plans. The announcement must be made through official government channels, such as a press release, government website, or an official speech. The initiative must aim at leveraging Formula 1 racing for economic benefits, including but not limited to tourism enhancement, infrastructure development, or technological innovation. Confirmation from at least two reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) is required in the absence of a direct government announcement. The political figure must hold a national office (e.g., President, Prime Minister, Cabinet Member) at the time of the announcement. Initiatives focused solely on local or regional development, or statements lacking formal government backing, do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will a new vaccine for a major infectious disease be approved by the FDA by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved a new vaccine for a major infectious disease. A "major infectious disease" is defined as a disease that has caused significant morbidity or mortality in the United States or globally within the last 10 years, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The approval must be for a vaccine that has not been previously available in the United States, and it must be intended for widespread use rather than limited to emergency authorization. The resolution will be based on official FDA announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The vaccine must be available for distribution within the United States to count towards this question's resolution.

Q_given_P.title: Given a new vaccine for a major infectious disease is approved by the FDA by 2025, will the World Health Organization declare a global health emergency due to climate-related diseases by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved a new vaccine for a major infectious disease. A "major infectious disease" is defined as a disease that has caused significant morbidity or mortality in the United States or globally within the last 10 years, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The resolution will be based on official FDA announcements or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The vaccine must be available for distribution within the United States to count towards this question's resolution.

Then, will the World Health Organization declare a global health emergency specifically due to the rise in diseases directly attributed to climate change by December 31, 2030? Such diseases may include, but are not limited to, vector-borne diseases, water-borne diseases, food safety and nutrition-related conditions, and respiratory and cardiovascular diseases linked to air pollution. The declaration must be made explicitly in relation to climate change impacts on health, and must be documented through official WHO announcements or press releases. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the declaration will be sufficient for resolution. Temporary alerts or warnings specific to individual diseases or regions do not count towards this question's resolution.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given a new vaccine for a major infectious disease is approved by the FDA by 2025 and the WHO declares a global health emergency due to climate-related diseases by 2030, will Germany achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels by 2025?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Germany has officially achieved a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels. The assessment must be based on the official data released by the German Federal Environment Agency (Umweltbundesamt) or an equivalent authoritative body. The emissions data must include all sectors of the economy, including energy, industrial processes, agriculture, waste management, and land use, land-use change, and forestry (LULUCF). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the achievement are sufficient. Interim targets or projections do not count towards this question's resolution. The question will resolve as No if the required reduction is not met or officially confirmed by the resolution date.

P.title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, machine learning algorithms have been demonstrated to surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior in at least one major industry (e.g., retail, finance, entertainment). P.title: Will the United States enter a recession before 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the United States officially enters a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) of the U.S. Department of Commerce. The determination of a recession by the National Bureau of Economic Research (NBER), which is considered the authoritative body on U.S. recessions, will also result in a Yes resolution. In the absence of an official declaration, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the recession will be sufficient for resolution. This question resolves as NO if these conditions are not met by the specified date.

Preliminary discussions, proposals, or mentions that do not lead to a formal introduction do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will significant advancements in climatology lead to a major shift in global climate policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, significant advancements in climatology result in a major shift in global climate policy. A "significant advancement" in climatology is defined as a breakthrough in climate science that leads to a new understanding of climate systems, significantly improves climate models, or provides novel solutions to climate change. A "major shift" in global climate policy is defined as the adoption of new, substantial climate policies or amendments to existing policies by at least three of the following entities: the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the European Union, the United States, China, and India. These policies must represent a significant departure from current strategies and aim to substantially reduce greenhouse gas emissions or enhance climate resilience. The shift must be confirmed by official documentation from the relevant entities or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

Q_given_P.title: Given significant advancements in climatology lead to a major shift in global climate policy by 2030, will a breakthrough in aerospace engineering lead to a significant improvement in global pandemic response capabilities by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:

Additionally, a breakthrough in aerospace engineering must lead to a significant improvement in global pandemic response capabilities by 2030. A "significant improvement" is defined as a development that enables at least a 30% reduction in global pandemic response time or a 20% increase in the distribution efficiency of medical supplies, vaccines, or personnel compared to 2023 standards. The breakthrough must be in the field of aerospace engineering and directly contribute to the improvement of pandemic response capabilities. This includes, but is not limited to, innovations in aircraft design, logistics, and transportation technologies that enhance the speed, efficiency, or reach of pandemic response efforts. The improvement must be documented and recognized by at least one of the following: the World Health Organization (WHO), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), or a similar authoritative public health body. In the absence of official recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or experimental deployments do not count towards this question's resolution.

This includes, but is not limited to, innovations in aircraft design, logistics, and transportation technologies that enhance the speed, efficiency, or reach of pandemic response efforts. The improvement must be documented and recognized by at least one of the following: the World Health Organization (WHO), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), or a similar authoritative public health body. In the absence of official recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or experimental deployments do not count towards this question's resolution.

R.title: Will a significant discovery in space lead to a new economic model or job sector as predicted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2030?
R.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in space leads to the creation of a new economic model or job sector, as predicted or recognized by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). A "significant discovery in space" refers to any discovery beyond Earth's atmosphere that has a direct and substantial impact on economic models, job creation, or the restructuring of existing job sectors. The new economic model or job sector must be officially acknowledged by the BLS in their publications or on their official website. In the absence of direct acknowledgment from the BLS, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the economic impact of the discovery will suffice. The discovery must lead to the creation of jobs that did not exist prior to the discovery, and these jobs must be recognized as part of a new sector or economic model. Temporary or speculative job creation does not meet this criterion. The question resolves as Yes only if the new economic model or job sector is operational and recognized by the end of 2030.

reasons: Advancements in climatology and aerospace engineering could both be driven by technological innovations, and breakthroughs in one field might inspire or facilitate breakthroughs in another.
A significant discovery in space could lead to new technologies or materials that impact both climate policy and pandemic response capabilities.
Global policy shifts in response to climate advancements might influence funding and priorities in aerospace engineering and space exploration, potentially leading to breakthroughs in those areas.
relevance.conclusion: There are plausible reasons to consider the logical combination of these questions, as advancements in one area could influence or be influenced by advancements in the others.

P.title: Will Spain achieve its goal of 100% renewable energy for electricity production by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Spain has officially achieved its goal of utilizing 100% renewable energy sources for its electricity production. The energy sources considered renewable include solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass. The achievement must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The resolution will consider the net electricity production over the calendar year 2030, accounting for any imports or exports of electricity. In the event of a temporary shortfall in renewable energy production, the question will resolve as No unless the shortfall is rectified and the 100% renewable goal is met by the end of 2030.

Q_given_P.title: Given Spain achieves its goal of 100% renewable energy for electricity production by 2030, will a biotechnology breakthrough lead to a significant increase in global GDP by 2030?

In the event of multiple contributing factors to GDP growth, the biotechnology breakthrough must be identified as the primary driver. This question does not consider incremental improvements in existing biotechnologies but focuses on a novel breakthrough that marks a significant departure from current capabilities.

P.title: Will a new technology emerge by 2025 that significantly improves the detection and treatment of infectious diseases?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new technology has emerged that significantly improves the detection and treatment of infectious diseases. Significant improvement is defined as:
- A reduction in detection time by at least 50% compared to the best available technology as of 2023.
- An increase in detection accuracy to at least 95%.
- A treatment method that reduces recovery time by at least 30% or increases the survival rate of severe cases by at least 20%, compared to the best available treatments as of 2023.
The emergence of such technology must be confirmed by the publication of results in at least two peer-reviewed scientific journals or an official announcement from a recognized health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC). Technologies that are only in the trial phase by the resolution date do not count. In the event of multiple technologies emerging, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

Q_given_P.title: Given a new technology emerges by 2025 that significantly improves the detection and treatment of infectious diseases, will France experience a major social movement leading to significant policy changes by 2030?

Given this, will France experience a major social movement leading to significant policy changes by 2030? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has experienced a major social movement that leads to significant policy changes. A "major social movement" is defined as a widespread mobilization of people across multiple cities, recognized by major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Le Monde, France24) and involving at least 100,000 participants in total. "Significant policy changes" refer to legislative or executive actions that alter national policy in at least one of the following areas: labor laws, environmental regulations, social welfare, or civil rights. The changes must be directly attributable to the social movement and recognized as such by at least two of the aforementioned news organizations. In the event of multiple movements, the question resolves as Yes if any one of them meets these criteria. Temporary or symbolic measures do not count towards this question's resolution.

A "major discovery" is defined as a finding that substantially alters the understanding of disease transmission, prevention, or treatment, and is recognized as such by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of public health. A "significant shift" in global health policy refers to the adoption of new guidelines, practices, or strategies by at least three G20 countries, as a direct result of the discovery, that markedly change the approach to disease prevention, management, or containment. The shift must be documented by official government announcements, policy documents, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Discoveries that only lead to minor adjustments or are limited to national or regional significance do not meet this criterion. The resolution will consider only those changes that are implemented and publicly acknowledged by the respective governments or organizations by the resolution date.

P.title: Will NASA's commercial partnerships significantly boost the space economy by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA's commercial partnerships have led to a significant boost in the space economy, as evidenced by:

- A minimum of 50% increase in global space industry revenue compared to 2020, adjusted for inflation. This includes revenues from satellite launches, space tourism, space mining, and other commercial space activities.

- The establishment of at least one commercially viable off-Earth manufacturing facility or habitat, operational and generating revenue.

- The successful launch and operation of at least five significant new commercial space missions (e.g., satellite constellations, space tourism missions, asteroid mining operations) directly resulting from NASA's partnerships.

Significant boost will be determined based on reports from authoritative sources in the space industry, such as the Space Foundation, the International Astronautical Federation, or equivalent. In the absence of direct reports, credible coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Economist) will be considered.

In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific and commercial space community will be used to determine the outcome.

Then, is the following true: By December 31, 2030, the United States is recognized as the global leader in the development of quantum computing technology. Leadership will be determined based on the following criteria:

- Number of quantum computers developed that surpass the capabilities of existing classical computers in significant computational tasks (quantum supremacy).
- Volume and impact of peer-reviewed scientific publications originating from the United States that contribute to quantum computing technology.
- Investment in quantum computing research and development by both the public and private sectors in the United States, compared to other countries.

Global leadership must be recognized by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the International Quantum Computing Association, the IEEE Quantum Computing Task Force, or significant coverage in at least three major technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, MIT Technology Review, Nature).

In the event of a dispute over leadership, the consensus among these sources will be considered definitive.

P.title: Will NASA's commercial partnerships significantly boost the space economy by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA's commercial partnerships have led to a significant boost in the space economy, as evidenced by:

- A minimum of 50% increase in global space industry revenue compared to 2020, adjusted for inflation. This includes revenues from satellite launches, space tourism, space mining, and other commercial space activities.

- The establishment of at least one commercially viable off-Earth manufacturing facility or habitat, operational and generating revenue.

- The successful launch and operation of at least five significant new commercial space missions (e.g., satellite constellations, space tourism missions, asteroid mining operations) directly resulting from NASA's partnerships.

Significant boost will be determined based on reports from authoritative sources in the space industry, such as the Space Foundation, the International Astronautical Federation, or equivalent. In the absence of direct reports, credible coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Economist) will be considered.

In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific and commercial space community will be used to determine the outcome.

Q.title: Will the United States lead the world in quantum computing technology development by 2030?
Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is recognized as the global leader in the development of quantum computing technology. Leadership will be determined based on the following criteria:

- Number of quantum computers developed that surpass the capabilities of existing classical computers in significant computational tasks (quantum supremacy).
- Volume and impact of peer-reviewed scientific publications originating from the United States that contribute to quantum computing technology.
- Investment in quantum computing research and development by both the public and private sectors in the United States, compared to other countries.

Global leadership must be recognized by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the International Quantum Computing Association, the IEEE Quantum Computing Task Force, or significant coverage in at least three major technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, MIT Technology Review, Nature).

In the event of a dispute over leadership, the consensus among these sources will be considered definitive.

R.title: Will a new social science theory emerge by 2030 that significantly improves our understanding of immune system-related behaviors?
R.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new social science theory has emerged that significantly improves our understanding of immune system-related behaviors. Significant improvement in understanding is defined as a theory that leads to new research directions, methodologies, or interventions that are demonstrably effective in understanding or modifying immune system-related behaviors. The emergence of the theory must be documented in at least one peer-reviewed journal within the social sciences and cited by other scholars in subsequent research. In the absence of a single defining publication, a consensus among experts in the field, as evidenced by a special issue in a reputable journal or a dedicated session in a major social science conference, may also suffice. This question resolves as YES upon the publication of such a theory or the consensus of experts, otherwise, it resolves as NO.

P.title: Will Australia launch a national cryptocurrency by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Australia has officially launched a national cryptocurrency. A "national cryptocurrency" is defined as a digital currency that is issued and regulated by the Australian government, recognized as legal tender within Australia, and intended for general public use. The launch must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational and available for public use, not in a trial phase. In the event of a limited launch (e.g., restricted to specific regions or for specific applications), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for nationwide use.

P.title: Will the Democratic Party (US) implement a policy that significantly influences social sciences research by 2025?

Q_given_P.title: Given the Democratic Party (US) implements a policy that significantly influences social sciences research by 2025, will a significant political philosophy movement emerge that influences a major election outcome before 2030?

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Conditional on the Democratic Party implementing a policy that significantly influences social sciences research by 2025 and a significant political philosophy movement emerging that influences a major election outcome before 2030, will Ukraine's GDP per capita surpass that of Poland before 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) By December 31, 2025, the Democratic Party in the United States has implemented a policy that significantly influences social sciences research. Significant influence is defined as:
- The allocation of federal funding specifically earmarked for social sciences research, resulting in a noticeable increase in research activities or projects;
- The establishment of new federal guidelines or standards for social sciences research that lead to widespread changes in research methodologies, ethical considerations, or subject matter focus within the United States;
- The enactment of legislation that directly impacts the direction, funding, or execution of social sciences research on a national scale.

The policy must be officially adopted and announced by the Democratic Party or through legislative action where the Democratic Party holds a majority. Confirmation of such a policy must come from official government publications or statements. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

(b) Before January 1, 2030, a significant political philosophy movement emerges that directly influences the outcome of a major election in any country recognized by the United Nations. A "significant political philosophy movement" is defined as a movement with a coherent set of ideological principles that significantly diverges from the existing mainstream political ideologies and has a substantial following. The influence on a major election outcome must be evidenced by:
- The movement's endorsement of a candidate or party that wins an election.
- Policy proposals from the movement being adopted by a winning candidate or party.
- Significant voter turnout or shift attributed to the movement's influence, as reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, etc.) or recognized political analysis institutions.

The emergence of the movement and its influence on the election must be clearly documented and recognized by credible sources. In the event of ambiguity or multiple movements claiming influence, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert analysis and reporting.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine's GDP per capita, as reported by the World Bank or another internationally recognized economic organization, surpasses that of Poland for any fiscal year. The GDP per capita should be calculated based on current US dollars for consistency. In the event that the World Bank or the designated authoritative source discontinues its reporting or significantly changes its methodology, an alternative reputable source will be used, following the same criteria for GDP per capita calculation. This question does not consider temporary fluctuations; the GDP per capita must be higher in one fiscal year compared to the previous year's report for Poland.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution. In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community, as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals, will be considered.

R.title: Will SpaceX's Starship enable the commercialization of space travel by 2025?
R.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX has officially begun commercial operations of its Starship spacecraft for the purpose of space travel accessible to non-governmental, paying customers. Commercialization is defined as offering and conducting paid space travel services to individuals or private entities beyond governmental or scientific missions. The service must be operational, with at least one commercial flight completed. Confirmation must come from an official SpaceX announcement or credible media reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of a partial service offering (e.g., limited to specific routes or types of customers), the question will resolve as Yes if the service is intended for broader public availability. Temporary or promotional one-off flights do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in image recognition by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, machine learning algorithms have surpassed human accuracy in image recognition tasks. 

"Human accuracy" refers to the average accuracy rate of a group of humans (at least 100 individuals) performing the same image recognition tasks under controlled conditions. 

"Surpass" is defined as achieving a higher accuracy rate, confirmed by at least two independent studies published in peer-reviewed scientific journals or presented at major AI or computer science conferences. 

The studies must compare the performance of machine learning algorithms directly against human performance on identical tasks. The resolution will be based on the consensus of the scientific community or authoritative sources in the field of artificial intelligence and computer science.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on machine learning algorithms surpassing human accuracy in image recognition by 2025, will the Virginia Department of Health influence a significant change in election health safety protocols before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) has influenced a significant change in election health safety protocols in Virginia. A "significant change" is defined as a new or revised set of guidelines or regulations that materially alter the way elections are conducted in terms of health safety, with the aim of preventing disease transmission during the voting process. This could include, but is not limited to, changes in voting booth sanitation, the implementation of social distancing measures, adjustments to voting times or locations to reduce crowding, or the introduction of mail-in voting or electronic voting options as standard practice. The change must be officially announced by the VDH or a related government body and must be implemented statewide. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of the VDH's influence on the change. Temporary measures introduced for a single election do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will a major geopolitical event significantly impact international soccer tournaments by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted the scheduling, location, participation, or overall execution of international soccer tournaments.

A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the government or military actions of one or more countries, leading to widespread international reactions or sanctions. Examples include, but are not limited to, wars, significant diplomatic disputes, economic sanctions, or major political changes.

The impact on soccer tournaments must be confirmed by FIFA or UEFA through official announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will resolve as No if no such events or impacts are confirmed by the resolution date.

P.title: Will there be a significant discovery in robotics that contributes to the advancement of natural sciences by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in robotics has been made that contributes to the advancement of the natural sciences. A "significant discovery" is defined as a development in robotics technology or application that leads to a breakthrough in understanding, methodology, or application in any field of the natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics, earth science). The discovery must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, citation in multiple subsequent research works, or acknowledgment by a reputable scientific organization. The advancement must be directly attributable to the robotics discovery and represent a clear departure from existing capabilities or knowledge. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. Discoveries that are primarily advancements in computer science or engineering without direct application to the natural sciences do not count towards this question's resolution.

Discoveries made but not recognized within the timeframe do not count towards this question's resolution.
