This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, AI-driven legislative analysis tools are widely used by members of the US Congress to inform their decision-making processes. "Widely used" is defined as being utilized by at least 50% of voting members in either the House of Representatives or the Senate for the analysis of legislative texts, prediction of legislative outcomes, or guidance on policy impacts. The use of such tools must be confirmed by official statements from Congress, documented in credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post), or through peer-reviewed research publications. In the absence of clear public statements, evidence from multiple reputable sources indicating widespread adoption among Congress members will be considered sufficient. AI-driven tools must perform tasks beyond simple data aggregation, including but not limited to predictive analytics, natural language processing for understanding and summarizing texts, and simulation models to forecast policy outcomes. Tools used in a trial phase or for a limited period do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the US Congress passes a major electoral reform bill. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. In the event of a partial implementation of the bill's provisions (e.g., if certain sections are not enacted or are delayed), the question will resolve as Yes only if the implemented sections include significant changes to at least two of the areas mentioned above.

P.title: Will China lead the world in quantum computing research by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, China is recognized as the global leader in quantum computing research. Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:

- Publication Volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.
- Citation Impact: Chinese publications in quantum computing must have the highest citation impact, indicating significant influence on the field.
- Technological Breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.

Recognition of China's leadership position must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum, or the annual reports of the National Quantum Initiative or the European Quantum Flagship program.

In the event of a tie in any of the criteria above, additional factors such as international awards in quantum computing, or leadership in international quantum computing collaborations, may be considered.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will China lead the world in quantum computing research by 2030, will there be a significant shift in environmental philosophy influencing global climate policy by 2030, and will the United Nations establish a new space-related treaty or agreement by 2025?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following occur:

1. China is recognized as the global leader in quantum computing research by December 31, 2030. Leadership in quantum computing research is defined by the following criteria:
   - Publication Volume: China must have the highest number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, compared to any other country.
   - Citation Impact: Chinese publications in quantum computing must have the highest citation impact, indicating significant influence on the field.
   - Technological Breakthroughs: China must have achieved at least one major technological breakthrough in quantum computing that is recognized by the international scientific community.
   - Recognition of China's leadership position must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum, or the annual reports of the National Quantum Initiative or the European Quantum Flagship program.
   - In the event of a tie in any of the criteria above, additional factors such as international awards in quantum computing, or leadership in international quantum computing collaborations, may be considered.

2. There is a significant shift in environmental philosophy that influences global climate policy by December 31, 2030. A "significant shift" is defined as the adoption of a new or substantially revised environmental philosophy that leads to the implementation of new global climate policies or the amendment of existing ones. This shift must be recognized and reported by at least three major international organizations involved in climate change (e.g., United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, World Meteorological Organization) or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The new or revised philosophy must lead to actionable policy changes at the international level, such as new global agreements, significant amendments to existing treaties, or the establishment of new global climate goals. The resolution will consider the consensus of the scientific community and authoritative sources on the matter. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the preponderance of evidence from the specified sources.

3. The United Nations establishes a new space-related treaty or agreement by December 31, 2025. The treaty or agreement must be formally adopted by the United Nations General Assembly or an equivalent body and must address issues such as space territory, resource utilization, space debris management, or the militarization of space. Confirmation must come from an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The treaty or agreement must be new, not an amendment or extension of existing treaties. In the event of a dispute over the novelty of the treaty or agreement, the question will resolve based on the consensus of legal experts in international space law.

P.title: Will France see a major electoral reform as a result of a significant social movement before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, France undergoes a major electoral reform directly attributed to a significant social movement. A "major electoral reform" is defined as a change in the electoral system that affects the method of voting, the way votes are counted, or the structure of representation in at least one chamber of the national parliament. A "significant social movement" must be a widespread, organized campaign or protest recognized by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Le Monde, New York Times, Washington Post) as having a substantial impact on public opinion or policy. The reform must be officially adopted by the French government and reported by at least one of these news organizations. In the event of ambiguous situations, such as reforms proposed but not implemented, or minor changes presented as major, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered on their individual merits, with a preference for consensus among reputable sources.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on France seeing a major electoral reform as a result of a significant social movement before 2030, will a new AI-driven epidemiology tool predict the next global pandemic with over 90% accuracy before 2030?

Additionally, a new AI-driven epidemiology tool must be developed and successfully predict the next global pandemic with over 90% accuracy before January 1, 2030. The prediction must be specific to the pathogen type (e.g., virus, bacteria), its origin, and the timeframe of outbreak. The tool's prediction accuracy must be verified by a consensus of at least three leading health organizations (e.g., WHO, CDC, ECDC) or by publication in at least three peer-reviewed scientific journals. The tool must be publicly acknowledged by these organizations or publications as having met the 90% accuracy threshold in its prediction. In the event of multiple tools meeting these criteria, the resolution will be based on the first tool to be publicly acknowledged as meeting the accuracy threshold. Predictions made retrospectively, after the pandemic has begun, do not count towards this question's resolution.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

P.title: Will a major engineering breakthrough in renewable energy technology occur by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major engineering breakthrough in renewable energy technology is announced and recognized by the scientific community or a reputable energy sector authority. A "major engineering breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly enhances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or scalability of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, or biomass. The breakthrough must represent a clear advancement beyond the current state of the art and have the potential to substantially impact global renewable energy production or consumption. The announcement of the breakthrough must be confirmed by an official press release from a leading scientific institution, energy company, or government agency. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be demonstrable and verifiable, not merely theoretical or speculative. In the event of multiple claims, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one is widely accepted by the scientific community or a reputable energy sector authority.

Then, will a major breakthrough in autonomous vehicle technology be achieved by December 31, 2025? A major breakthrough in autonomous vehicle technology is defined as:

- The development and successful public demonstration of an autonomous vehicle capable of navigating complex urban environments without human intervention, with a success rate of at least 95%.
- The breakthrough must be recognized by a leading industry body or consortium in the field of robotics or autonomous vehicles, such as the Association for Advancing Automation (A3) or the International Federation of Robotics (IFR).

The breakthrough must be documented in at least two reputable technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, Science Daily) or in peer-reviewed scientific journals. 

In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the resolution will be based on the first documented instance meeting the above criteria. 

Developments that only incrementally improve existing technologies without demonstrating a significant leap in capabilities will not be considered a major breakthrough for the purpose of this question.

P.title: Will a major discovery in epidemiology lead to a significant shift in global health policy by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major discovery in the field of epidemiology leads to a significant shift in global health policy. A "major discovery" is defined as a finding that substantially alters the understanding of disease transmission, prevention, or treatment, and is recognized as such by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of public health. A "significant shift" in global health policy refers to the adoption of new guidelines, practices, or strategies by at least three G20 countries, as a direct result of the discovery, that markedly change the approach to disease prevention, management, or containment. The shift must be documented by official government announcements, policy documents, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Discoveries that only lead to minor adjustments or are limited to national or regional significance do not meet this criterion. The resolution will consider only those changes that are implemented and publicly acknowledged by the respective governments or organizations by the resolution date.

The establishment of the framework must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The framework must include specific guidelines or principles addressing ethical considerations related to AI, such as transparency, accountability, privacy, and fairness. In the event of a partial or preliminary framework, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear commitment and timeline for the adoption of a comprehensive global framework.

P.title: Will Google announce a significant breakthrough in natural sciences research by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Google (or any of its subsidiaries) officially announces a significant breakthrough in the field of natural sciences. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that represents a major advancement in understanding or application in any of the natural sciences (including, but not limited to, biology, chemistry, physics, earth science, and astronomy). The announcement must be made through an official Google press release or a publication in a reputable scientific journal. The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, as evidenced by coverage in at least three major science news outlets (e.g., Scientific American, Nature News, Science Daily) or citations in peer-reviewed scientific journals. In the absence of widespread recognition, the question will resolve as No. The breakthrough must be new, not a continuation or incremental improvement of existing technologies or research.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Google announcing a significant breakthrough in natural sciences research by 2025, will California implement a state-backed cryptocurrency by 2025?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By December 31, 2025, Google (or any of its subsidiaries) officially announces a significant breakthrough in the field of natural sciences. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that represents a major advancement in understanding or application in any of the natural sciences (including, but not limited to, biology, chemistry, physics, earth science, and astronomy). The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, as evidenced by coverage in at least three major science news outlets (e.g., Scientific American, Nature News, Science Daily) or citations in peer-reviewed scientific journals. In the absence of widespread recognition, the question will resolve as No. The breakthrough must be new, not a continuation or incremental improvement of existing technologies or research.

2. By December 31, 2025, the state of California has officially implemented a state-backed cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and regulated by an official state authority, such as the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation, and must be designed for use as a legal tender within the state. Implementation is defined as the cryptocurrency being publicly available for use in transactions and recognized by the state for tax payments or other governmental fees. Confirmation of implementation must come from an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The cryptocurrency must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific sectors or regions), the question will resolve as Yes if the cryptocurrency is intended for statewide use.

If the first condition is not met, this question will resolve as N/A.

P.title: Will a major geopolitical event significantly impact international soccer tournaments by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted the scheduling, location, participation, or overall execution of international soccer tournaments.

A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the government or military actions of one or more countries, leading to widespread international reactions or sanctions. Examples include, but are not limited to, wars, significant diplomatic disputes, economic sanctions, or major political changes.

The impact on soccer tournaments must be confirmed by FIFA or UEFA through official announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will resolve as No if no such events or impacts are confirmed by the resolution date.

Q_given_P.title: Given a major geopolitical event significantly impacts international soccer tournaments by 2025, will a major breakthrough in biotechnology significantly reduce carbon emissions by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2025, a major geopolitical event has significantly impacted the scheduling, location, participation, or overall execution of international soccer tournaments. A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that involves the government or military actions of one or more countries, leading to widespread international reactions or sanctions. Examples include, but are not limited to, wars, significant diplomatic disputes, economic sanctions, or major political changes. The impact on soccer tournaments must be confirmed by FIFA or UEFA through official announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

Then, will a major breakthrough in biotechnology significantly reduce global carbon emissions by December 31, 2030? A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development in biotechnology that leads to a reduction in global carbon emissions by at least 10% compared to the year 2020 levels, as reported by the International Energy Agency (IEA) or an equivalent authoritative body. The breakthrough must be in the field of biotechnology, including but not limited to, genetic engineering, microbial fuel cells, algae biofuels, or carbon capture and storage technologies. The reduction in emissions must be directly attributable to the application of the biotechnology, and not a result of external factors such as economic downturns or reductions in industrial activity. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution. In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community, as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals, will be considered.

P.title: Will robotics achieve a major breakthrough in autonomous vehicle technology by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in autonomous vehicle technology is achieved, defined as:

- The development and successful public demonstration of an autonomous vehicle capable of navigating complex urban environments without human intervention, with a success rate of at least 95%.
- The breakthrough must be recognized by a leading industry body or consortium in the field of robotics or autonomous vehicles, such as the Association for Advancing Automation (A3) or the International Federation of Robotics (IFR).

The breakthrough must be documented in at least two reputable technology or science news outlets (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, Science Daily) or in peer-reviewed scientific journals. 

In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the resolution will be based on the first documented instance meeting the above criteria. 

Developments that only incrementally improve existing technologies without demonstrating a significant leap in capabilities will not be considered a major breakthrough for the purpose of this question.

P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the day following the US presidential election in 2024, a major shift in energy policy is widely credited by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) with having a significant influence on the election outcome. P.title: Will the US House of Representatives pass significant legislation to regulate artificial intelligence by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the US House of Representatives has passed legislation that significantly regulates artificial intelligence (AI) in any of the following areas: development, deployment, ethical use, privacy, security, or bias mitigation. 

Significant legislation is defined as a bill that introduces new regulations or substantially amends existing regulations on AI. The bill must be passed by the US House of Representatives and must not be solely symbolic; it must have practical implications for the regulation of AI. 

The passage of the legislation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the criteria outlined above.

P.title: Will SpaceX's Starlink project generate over $30 billion in revenue by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX's Starlink project has officially generated over $30 billion in total revenue. Total revenue refers to the cumulative revenue from all Starlink operations and services globally, including but not limited to satellite internet services, government contracts, and any other revenue streams directly attributable to the Starlink project. Revenue figures must be confirmed by SpaceX through official financial statements or reports. In the absence of direct confirmation from SpaceX, credible reports from at least three major financial news organizations (Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, Financial Times) are sufficient. The calculation of total revenue should adhere to generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) or international financial reporting standards (IFRS).

P.title: Will Virginia lead the US in nuclear energy production by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the state of Virginia has the highest nuclear energy production capacity in the United States, measured in megawatts (MW). Nuclear energy production capacity is defined as the maximum output of electricity a nuclear power plant can produce under specific conditions. The resolution will be based on the official data published by the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) or another authoritative source designated by the U.S. Department of Energy. In the event that the EIA does not publish data for 2030 by the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the most recent data available. If Virginia leads in nuclear energy production at any point in 2030 according to the latest data, the question will resolve as Yes. In case of a tie in production capacity between Virginia and another state, the question will resolve as Yes.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on Virginia leading the US in nuclear energy production by 2030, will the global average temperature rise by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels by 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. By December 31, 2030, the state of Virginia has the highest nuclear energy production capacity in the United States, measured in megawatts (MW). Nuclear energy production capacity is defined as the maximum output of electricity a nuclear power plant can produce under specific conditions. The resolution will be based on the official data published by the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) or another authoritative source designated by the U.S. Department of Energy. In the event that the EIA does not publish data for 2030 by the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the most recent data available. If Virginia leads in nuclear energy production at any point in 2030 according to the latest data, the question will resolve as Yes. In case of a tie in production capacity between Virginia and another state, the question will resolve as Yes.

P.title: Will SpaceX's Starship enable the commercialization of space travel by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX has officially begun commercial operations of its Starship spacecraft for the purpose of space travel accessible to non-governmental, paying customers. Commercialization is defined as offering and conducting paid space travel services to individuals or private entities beyond governmental or scientific missions. The service must be operational, with at least one commercial flight completed. Confirmation must come from an official SpaceX announcement or credible media reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of a partial service offering (e.g., limited to specific routes or types of customers), the question will resolve as Yes if the service is intended for broader public availability. Temporary or promotional one-off flights do not count towards this question's resolution.

P.title: Will Brazil achieve a 20% reduction in deforestation rates by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Brazil has achieved a 20% reduction in deforestation rates compared to the baseline year of 2020. The deforestation rates will be measured by the official data published by the Brazilian National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or its successor organization. The measurement will be based on the annual deforestation rates reported in the Amazon region, which is the primary focus of deforestation monitoring in Brazil. In the event that INPE or its successor organization ceases to exist or does not publish annual deforestation data, this question will resolve based on data from a comparable authoritative source, such as the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) or the World Resources Institute (WRI). Should there be significant discrepancies between sources, the resolution will consider a consensus of these reports. Temporary fluctuations in deforestation rates that do not reflect a sustained reduction over the five-year period do not count towards this question's resolution.

The new economic industry must be directly attributable to this breakthrough, with clear evidence of its establishment, such as the creation of new companies, significant investment, or the generation of substantial revenue. The breakthrough and the resulting industry must be documented and verified by credible sources, including but not limited to scientific journals, major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), and official statements from relevant scientific bodies. R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given a major breakthrough in particle physics leads to a new economic industry by 2040 and a major shift in energy policy influences the 2024 US presidential election, will France implement a nationwide carbon-neutral initiative by 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By December 31, 2040, a major breakthrough in particle physics has led to the establishment of a new economic industry. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of particle physics, and is recognized as such by the scientific community. The new economic industry must be directly attributable to this breakthrough, with clear evidence of its establishment, such as the creation of new companies, significant investment, or the generation of substantial revenue. The breakthrough and the resulting industry must be documented and verified by credible sources, including but not limited to scientific journals, major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), and official statements from relevant scientific bodies. In the event of multiple related breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one leads directly to the creation of a new industry. Additionally, by the day following the US presidential election in 2024, a major shift in energy policy is widely credited by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) with having a significant influence on the election outcome. A "major shift in energy policy" refers to a substantial change in national energy policy, including but not limited to the adoption of new renewable energy targets, significant alterations in fossil fuel regulations, or major federal investments in energy infrastructure. The influence on the election outcome must be explicitly mentioned as a contributing factor to the election results by the cited news organizations. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear consensus among reputable sources, the question will resolve as No.

Then, will France implement a nationwide carbon-neutral initiative by 2030? This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide initiative that is recognized as carbon-neutral. The initiative must encompass actions across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, industry, and agriculture, aimed at achieving a net-zero carbon footprint for the country.

The initiative must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

For the purpose of this question, "carbon-neutral" means that any carbon emissions produced by France are balanced by an equivalent amount of carbon sequestration or offsetting measures, within the same calendar year. The verification of carbon neutrality must be conducted by an independent, internationally recognized environmental organization.

In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide coverage by the end of 2030.
